title: Melatonin as a novel neuroprotectant in preterm infants
abstractText: Premature babies have a very high risk of growing up with cerebral palsy or other handicaps. We now want to use advanced brain imaging to test a possible treatment to reduce brain damage. Melatonin, a substance produced naturally by the brain and taken by many people to combat jet-lag seems to protect the immature brain from damage due to shortages of oxygen or infection. We want to see if it prevents brain damage in premature infants.
